exhibit number three is docket number s
36673 it's Chevron Phillips chemical
pipeline company application to increase
rates for transportation and petroleum
on this ethylene system for commission
tariff 9.5 is a discussion impossible
vote on staff's recommendation this was
exhibit four last month Chevron fought
its application with the commission on
February 3rd of 2023 requesting
authorization to increase his rates for
transportation of ethylene and it is a
for-profit jurisdictional common carrier
petroleum pipeline providing ethylene
from Napoleonville in Ascension Parish
to the American Centrex claim in St
James Parish the American Centrix plan
is CP Kim's Seoul Louisiana pipeline
customer CP Kim claims that an increase
is necessary due to a significant
reduction of throughput volume over the
past five years with costs remaining
relatively consistent over the same
period the company's initial request was
to increase its rates from 17.67 to 29.5
cents per 100 pounds the customer
provided note the customer was provided
notice of the proposed rate change via
email on August 29 2022 thank you
subsequent to the filing of the
application the company amended its
tariff via the ferc recently updated
annual index rate which allowed the
company to increase his rates from 17.6
cents to 20.02 cents per 100 pounds
effective July 1st 2023. thus the
company's request change to increase its
rates in cents from 20.02 to 29.50 per
100 pounds after a review of the five
years of financial data from the company
the ferc annual index multipliers and a
formal set of data requests staff agrees
that the increase is necessary and is
recommendation on July 21st 2023
recommending that the company be allowed
to increase its in-trust State
Transportation rates from 20.02 cents to
29.50 cents per 100 pounds with the
condition that if the customer volume
increases over 400 million 500 000
pounds staff recommends that the company
come back in to file with the commission
a reevaluation of its rates therefore
staff recommends that the commission
approved the staff report and
recommendation filed into the record on
July 21 2023
